title: Heacham Circular Walk Route

images.title: Peter Jemmett / The Wash, near Heacham
images.caption: The Wash, near Heacham. The tide is out leaving the late afternoon sun reflecting off the wet sand.

images.title: Ben Harris / Mouth of the Heacham River
images.caption: Mouth of the Heacham River. The Heacham River where it finally discharges into the waters of the Wash. Crossing it required some care, but the banks were solid enough at the downstream end.

images.title: John Wernham / The Old Railway Station at Heacham,Norfolk.
images.caption: The Old Railway Station at Heacham,Norfolk. The waiting rooms of this old railway station on the disused line between Kings Lynn and Hunstanton,has now been transformed into holiday homes.

images.title: Ben Harris / Heacham River across Stubborn Sand
images.caption: Heacham River across Stubborn Sand Even with the tide well out, the outfall of the Heacham River provides enough water on the beach for people to have fun in. Meanwhile, the flat sands are ideal for microlight aircraft, one of which can just be seen in the sky.

description: Enjoy fine views of The Wash on this circular walk from the Norfolk village of Heacham. The route runs for just over 3 miles so should suit most abilites. The attractive beaches in the village are a popular tourist spot in the summer months. They are among the few beaches in eastern England where the sun sets over the sea instead of over the land. You can start the walk from the public car park on the sea front, just to the west of the village at South Beach. From here you can pick up a coastal path running north along Stubborn Sands towards Hunstanton . You can then pick up another inland path, running along the golf course to bring you back towards Heacham. PE31 7LH
